intro: Philactis zinnioides, commonly known as the Zinnia-like False Caper, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and palmate leaves. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Its flowers are clustered in umbels and attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in wild settings.
